intro: Anacampseros ramosa, commonly known as the ghost plant, is a succulent species native to arid regions of southern Africa. It features a low-growing, sprawling form with fleshy, ribbed leaves that are typically blue-green in color. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the warmer months, which are borne on slender stems. Its leaves are adapted to store water, allowing it to survive in dry conditions. Anacampseros ramosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ease of care.
